results.byline: By Glenn Thrush, Maggie Haberman and Ben Protess
results.title: Garland Moves to Release Details on Search of Trump’s Home
results.abstract: The search was part of a government effort to account for materials related to some of the most highly classified programs run by the United States, a person briefed on the matter said.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump could oppose the motion to release the warrant and inventory of items taken from his home, and some of his aides were said to be leaning toward doing so.
media.copyright: Emil Lippe for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: James, Letitia;Trump, Donald J;Fischetti, Ronald P
results.title: Trump and James sat across from each other for hours as he said ‘same answer’ again and again.
results.abstract: A lawyer for Donald J. Trump said that over the course of about four hours, the former president answered only one question, about his name, toward the beginning of the interview.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump answered only one question during an interview with the New York State attorney general, his lawyer said.
media.copyright: Ash Adams for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Masks;Quarantines;Viruses;your-feed-health;Education (K-12);United States
results.title: C.D.C. Eases Covid Guidelines, Noting Virus Is ‘Here to Stay’
results.abstract: The new guidelines eliminate quarantines and put less emphasis on social distancing, routine surveillance testing and contact tracing.

media.caption: People who are exposed to the virus no longer need to quarantine at home, regardless of their vaccination status, according to the new guidelines, but they should wear a mask for 10 days and get tested for the virus on day 5.

results.byline: By Jonah E. Bromwich, Ben Protess and William K. Rashbaum
results.title: Trump Invokes Fifth Amendment, Attacking Legal System as Troubles Mount
results.abstract: The former president declined to answer questions from the office of the New York State attorney general, Letitia James, who leads one of a number of inquiries swirling around him.

media.caption: Donald J. Trump leaving Trump Tower in New York on Wednesday. Mr. Trump later invoked the 5th Amendment in declining to answer the New York attorney general’s questions.
media.copyright: Brittainy Newman for The New York Times

results.title: Silver-Haired and Shameless About Perks: Retirees Take Part-Time Work in the Travel Industry
results.abstract: Spend 15 hours a week loading baggage at the airport or passing out towels at the pool, and you can see Europe for a fraction of the usual cost.

media.caption: Joey Boyd-Scott, left, and her wife, Maria, both have part-time travel jobs. The ongoing labor shortage is pushing the sector to consider senior citizens for positions that are far from senior.
media.copyright: Beth Coller for The New York Times
